item.title: Pre-Think
item.description:
The maximum duration for which PCLS can maintain functional viability under in vitro culture conditions, (ideally up to two weeks).
Standardization of mouse strain selection and hepatic lobe sampling to improve the reproducibility of PCLS preparation.
Identification of viability and activity markers for PCLS beyond cleaved caspase 3.
Exploration of methodologies other than IHC and WB for assessing tissue viability and functional integrity.
Systematic benchmarking against the existing PCLS literature, including a consolidated summary of culture medium composition and critical operational parameters.
Establishment of a PCLS based experimental platform for MASH research, including the construction of a dedicated in vitro experimental unit and the overall experimental setup.

item.title: PCLS
item.description: Vibramote: Leica VT1000 SMethods Liver tissue was cored using a 8-mm Stiefel biopsy punch (Medisave, Weymouth, UK). Cores were transferred to a metal mould, submerged in 3% low geling temperature agarose (A9414; Sigma-Aldrich, Poole, UK), and placed on ice for 2-5 minutes. Agaroseembedded liver cores were superglued to the vibratome mounting stage, submersed in the media chamber containing 4°C Hank’s balanced salt solution+, and cut using a Leica VT1200S vibrating blade microtome (Leica Biosystems, Milton Keynes, UK) at a speed 0.3 mm/sec, amplitude 2 mm, and thickness (step size) of 250 μm (Fig. 1A). PCLSs were transferred onto 8-μm-pore Transwell inserts and cultured under static conditions in standard 12-well plates (Greiner Bio-One, Kremsmuenster, Austria) or in a modified tissue culture plate (BioR plate) and rocked on the bioreactor platform (patent PCT/GB2016/053310) at a flow rate of 18.136 μL/sec (Fig. 1B,C and Supporting Fig. S1A). For comparison, PCLS were cultured in Kirstall Quasivivo (qv500) units according to the manufacturer’s instructions (Supporting Fig. S1B). All PCLSs were cultured in Williams medium E (W4128; SigmaAldrich), supplemented with 1% penicillin/streptomycin and l-glutamine, 1× insulin transferrin-selenium X, and 2% fetal bovine serum (Thermo Fisher Scientific, Cramlington, UK), and 100 nM of dexamethasome (Cerilliant, Texas, USA) at 37°C, supplemented with 5% CO2. Media were changed daily.
